Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst - Supply Chain

Location: Jacksonville, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Apply Now

Share

Description

Johnson & Johnson Vision, a member of Johnson & Johnson's Family of Companies, is recruiting for a Senior Financial Analyst to support our Supply Chain Operations in Jacksonville, FL.

At Johnson & Johnson, we believe health is everything. Our strength in healthcare innovation empowers us to build a world where complex diseases are prevented, treated, and cured, where treatments are smarter and less invasive, and solutions are personal. Through our expertise in Innovative Medicine and MedTech, we are uniquely positioned to innovate across the full spectrum of healthcare solutions today to deliver the breakthroughs of tomorrow, and profoundly impact health for humanity. Learn more at https://www.jnj.com/.

The Senior Financial Analyst will provide financial guidance to leadership in optimizing the mix of productivity, efficiency and cost within a world class, highly automated 24 x 7 production operation. The team member will collaborate with Operations partners to ensure compliance and appropriate diligence across manufacturing platforms and processes. Additionally, the candidate will also provide full business partner support to key related functions including all planning and financial close cycle activities.

Key Responsibilities

 Lead the financial evaluation of production modeling including validation of inputs and assumptions.  Proactively partner with functional and project leads to ensure alignment of financial targets and identify potential opportunities and risks.  Educate non-financial business partners on financial issues and concepts.  Perform month end close activities and BVA reporting; including in-depth variance analysis to understand cost drivers and aid business partners in achieving financial commitments.  Ensure compliance with SOX and other internal policies and procedures 

Qualifications

 Bachelor’s Degree required; a major in Accounting or Finance preferred.  A minimum of 3 years of accounting, finance or related business experience required.  CPA and/or CMA preferred.  Excellent analytical, conceptual, communication and interpersonal skills are required.  Proactive and continuous-improvement oriented demeanor is required.  Strong financial analysis, business partnering and influencing skills are preferred.  Advanced knowledge of Excel is required.  Experience with data management and visualization tools such as Power BI and Alteryx preferred.  Intermediate to advanced SAP, TM1 or similar ERP system knowledge preferred.  This position is located in Jacksonville, FL and may require up to 5% domestic travel 

 Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
